name: water works construction, capacity 1.1E10l/year, conventional treatment | water works, capacity 1.1E10l/year | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/11092/documentation

This dataset is created as a child of global dataset with edited production volume for this geography.;;This dataset represents the construction of a medium-sized potable water conventional treatment plant 30 000m3/d with a lifetime of 60 years. Conventional treatment includes coagulation and decantation, filtration and disinfection. This dataset both conventional treatment systems and conventional with biological treatment. Dataset is extrapolated from a small conventional treatment plant in Saint-François-Rivière-du-sud, Quebec (CA): average flow of 1500 m3/d and is assumed to have a 60 years lifetime. Inventory is extrapolated to a medium-size plant based on cost curve. Lifetime is assumed to be 13 years for mechanical equipment (e.g. pumps), 30 years for chemical tanks and 60 years for structural components.   Note that a major source of uncertainty in this dataset is the use of cost scaling factors outside their reported range of validity: the cost scaling factors are reported to be valid for capacities of 3785 m3/d to 378540 m3/d, and the actual plant that served as basis for this dataset is has an average flow of 1500 m3/d. This uncertainty is accounted for through the “Further technological correlation” data quality indicator.;[This dataset is meant to replace the following datasets:; - water works construction, CH, 1993 - 1998 (8d255bcd-a617-4a11-9555-0017d064fae3)]

From reception of raw materials and construction equipment. This dataset includes material inputs for equipment of the different water treatment stages:  intake pumping, coagulation, flocculation, clarification, filtration, ozonation and chlorination. A potable water reserve build underground (roof of the reserve is the floor of the water plant) is included in the inventory. Metal forming activities and associated losses were excluded. Energy and equipment needed for construction are excluded due to lack of data.  

This datasets ends with the dismantlement of the plant at the end of its useful life, expected to be 60 years. Input material end-of-life is included, but equipment and energy used for dismantling is excluded due to lack of data.
category: F:Construction/42:Civil engineering/422:Construction of utility projects/4220:Construction of utility projects

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Extrapolated from data from a single plant in Quebec (Canada).
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Municipal water treatment by conventional treatment with biological filtration.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: From single small-sized conventional treatment plant to global average middle-sized conventional treatment plant construction.  Extrapolation is based on scaling initial inventory to average size plant using published cost scaling curves from Kawamura (2008). This approach assumes that the economic scaling factor for larger size is applicable to material quantity. Dataset is parameterized based on average flow. The cost curve used for scaling is supposed to be applicable to plant size ranging from 10 to 100 MGD, i.e. it is used here outside the prescribed range of applicability. Uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Based on data collection at plant in 2009 and personal communication with the design engineer in 2013. Most data of these data have been published in Bonton, A., Bouchard, C., Barbeau, B., & Jedrzejak, S. (2012). Comparative life cycle assessment of water treatment plants. Desalination, 284, 42-54. Scaling to average size plant was based on economic scaling curve (Kawamura, S.,  McGivney, W. T. 2008. Cost Estimating Manual for Water Treatment Facilities, Willey, 224p.).
